Clinical practicum hours to be determined by gap analysis. Advanced Practice Nursing: Geriatrics | NYU College of Nursing                                Home   College Directory   Global   News                                           Menu     Search                                                      About   Academics   Admissions   Research   Our Practices   Students   Alumni                                     Sections                                 Resources                                          Undergraduate   Graduate MS   Advanced Certificate   Dual Degree BS/MS   Dual Degree MS/MPH   DNP   PhD   Compare DNP and PhD   Non-Degree     Clinical Experience   Academic Calendars   Academic Integrity   Academic Affairs   Technical Standards                            Contact                        Tara       A.      Cortes       Executive Director, The Hartford Institute for Geriatric Nursing , Professor of Geriatric Nursing       tara.cortes@nyu.edu      212-998-5320                          Downloads                         Advisement Form Geriatrics Interprofessional Primary Care.pdf                                              Academics                   Home > Academics > Graduate > Advanced Certificate > Overview > Advanced Practice Nursing: Geriatrics                                                                        Advanced Certificate                < Back Advanced Certificate Program in Advanced Practice Nursing: Geriatrics Program Highlights     Twelve (12) credit* Post-Master's Advanced Certificate focusing on Interprofessional Primary Care for Older Adults with Multiple Chronic Conditions prepares Adult Nurse Practitioners (ANPs) to (1) sit for the ANCC Adult-Gerontology Primary Care Nurse Practitioner Certification Exam and (2) provide specialized, high quality, culturally competent care to the vulnerable adult population.   Offers a student-centered learning environment:  “Executive Education” format tailored to the needs of a working professional    Flexible 12-credit* curriculum delivery model for practicing ANPs   Cutting-edge hybrid model with on-line resources       Provides an innovative interprofessional experience:    Shared learning with NYU School of Medicine Primary Care medical residents   Unique one-week summer intensive of shared didactic and clinical experience with medical residents and other professionals   Interprofessional team of nationally and internationally renowned faculty       Collaboration with the Hartford Institute for Geriatric Nursing   Focuses on the unique needs of older adults with multiple chronic conditions   Eligibility to sit for the ANCC Adult-Gerontology Primary Care NP Certification Exam     *Any other requirements to be determined through gap analysis   Program Requirements: Minimum of 12 credits; approximately 250 clinical hours (dependent on gap analysis of completed Master’s program)*   Eligibility     Graduation from a Master of Arts (MA), Master of Science (MS), or Master of Science in Nursing (MSN) Adult Nurse Practitioner (ANP) program at a CCNE or NLNAC accredited college or university   Graduation from a Post-Master’s Advanced Certificate Adult Nurse Practitioner (ANP) program at a CCNE or NLNAC accredited college or university   Minimum grade point average (GPA) from Master’s or Advanced Certificate program of 3.0   State of New York RN license and authorization to practice as an Adult Nurse Practitioner   Minimum of one year of clinical experience as an ANP       Technical Standards Requirements   Applicants must meet the Technical Standards for Core Professional Nursing Competency Performance in order to be eligible for admission to, progress in, and graduate from the nursing program at the NYU College of Nursing.   Criminal Background Check Policy   All candidates will be required to complete practicum learning experiences towards fulfilling the requirements of the master's of science degree in nursing or advanced certificate. Please be advised that prior to or during your practicum learning experiences at a health care acute, community, or private practice facility, that facility may require a criminal background check in order to meet the facility's clinical placement policy or requirements. Such checks may be conducted by the facility or the student may have to independently obtain a criminal background check that meets the facility's requirements. The NYU College of Nursing is not conducting such checks.   Advanced Certificate Programs follow MS Program Policies & Procedures .   Courses                Advanced Certificate: Geriatrics                                                                                     NURSE-GN 2176               Advanced Pathophysiology,Pharmacotherapeutics, and Physical Assessment              (3)             Spring                      NURSE-GN 2177               Primary Care of the Independent Older Adult with Multiple Chronic Conditions              (3)             Spring                      NURSE-GN TBD               Clinical Intensive in Interprofessional Care of Older Adults              (3)             Summer                      NURSE-GN TBD               Primary Care of the Frail Older Adult with Multiple Chronic Conditions              (3)             Fall                                   Practicum Opportunities                   Joint clinical experience with Medical Students at NYU School of Medicine   Virtual patient simulation   Placements are made in collaboration with faculty   Placement possibilities are available throughout the tri-state area                 Attachment Size     Advisement Form Geriatrics Interprofessional Primary Care.pdf 22.58 KB                          Graduate            MS MS Program Policies     Advanced Certificate Advanced Practice Nursing: Geriatrics Focus on Interprofessional Primary Care for Older Adults with Multiple Chronic Conditions   Advanced Practice Nursing: Palliative Care     Dual Degree BS/MS   Dual Degree MS/MPH   DNP   PhD PhD Admissions Policies   PhD Program Policies     Compare DNP and PhD   Non-Degree                            Back to top                                                    Contact   Academic Bulletin   Open Positions   Site Map   NYU College of Dentistry   Legal   Site Credits
